definition: to renovate/to refurbish/to refresh (computer window)/to write a new page (in history)/to break (a record)
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: This is the display refresh rate and set the refresh rate does not match the reasons why.
sentences.chinese: 這就是顯示刷新率與設置刷新率爲什麼不匹配的原因。

sentences.english: This is the display refresh rate and set the refresh rate does not match the reasons why.
sentences.chinese: 這就是顯示刷新率與設置刷新率爲什麼不匹配的原因。

sentences.english: Liverpool chalked up yet another home victory against Arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦隊又一次刷新了本地戰勝阿勝納隊的紀錄。

sentences.english: Refresh options are only ticked when using a populated model.
sentences.chinese: 刷新操作只有在使用已生成的模型時纔有效。

sentences.english: This enables the event window to be refreshed whenever messages are logged.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，每當在日誌中記錄消息時，會刷新事件窗口。

sentences.english: For some artists, the winning bids set new records.
sentences.chinese: 對一些藝術家來說，成交價刷新了紀錄。

sentences.english: Repaints a Form or control and refreshes any values.
sentences.chinese: 重新繪製窗體或控件並刷新任何值。

sentences.english: Dont want a page refresh for each tab tho, suggest ajax?
sentences.chinese: 不要想爲每個標籤頁面刷新芹苴，建議阿賈克斯？
過山車總是在不斷刷新記錄。

sentences.english: An asteroid seeding issue in the G5KW region has been addressed.
sentences.chinese: G5KW星域的小行星帶刷新問題已經提交。

sentences.english: The group policy framework should call the extension in the synchronous foreground policy refresh.
sentences.chinese: 在同步前臺策略刷新時，組策略框架應該調用擴展。

sentences.english: These mini-beetles will be the same ones from the Named Hive Defender (see above) but they will not respawn.
sentences.chinese: 這些小甲蟲同深谷衛兵一樣，但他們不會刷新出現。

sentences.english: Only user work items are refreshed in this manner.
sentences.chinese: 只有用戶工作項使用此方式進行刷新。

sentences.english: This method causes all controls bound to your model to be refreshed.
sentences.chinese: 此方法導致綁定到模型的所有控件被刷新。

definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
